3. POBDTPD (Poly(ethylene-co-butylene-co-1,4-dioxane-2,5-diyl) polymer)

Sure, here are the entities that refer to Material Property in the given paragraph:

The LUMO level is a property of a material that determines its electronics properties, such as conductivity and reactivity. Therefore, it can be considered a Material Property.

The LUMO level is a measure of the energy level at which a material's lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) is located. It is a useful property for comparing the electron affinity of different materials. In the paragraph, the LUMO level is mentioned as a way to rule out the PEBDTPD polymer as a candidate for a particular application.
